item.title: ACF and PACF on Generated Data
item.description: Simulating Data Simulating data under an ARIMA model in R is made rather easy. From the documentation on arima in stats, we obtain that $$ X_t = a1 X{t-1} + a{2} X{t-2} + \ldots + a{p} X{t-p} + b1 \epsilon{t-1} + b[2] \epsilon{t-2} + \ldots + b{q} \epsilon{t-q} $$ by construction. This can be adjusted with the rand.gen argument. library(ggplot2) library(forecast) my.data <- arima.sim(list(ar=c(0.7,0.2)), n=100) my.data2 <- data.frame(x=seq(1,100), y=my.data) ggplot(my.
